I had to do this too. Your DR. office or lab didn't give you a prep. list and ideas of what kinds of servings and foods to eat? Your suppose to eat normally and add 10 extra servings of carbs each 3 days. Breads- white or rye: 1 slice is one serving. 1 cup of cereal- grape nuts, ban flakes, etc. Mash potatoes, baked potatoes, french fries. Lots of pasta- 1 cup is a serving. I threw my list out last week because I passed. Sorry I can't think of anything else. Maybe you should call your DR. and ask them too. Good Luck sweetie!!! Hope you pass!! :)

Most likely she meant complex carbs, ie vegetables and fresh fruit.  Is this your first child?  I was diagnosed with my second and third children.  When first told I was devastated.  I followed my diet to a T, but to no avail.  I ended up still needing to take insulin.  After the shock, I calmed down and followed the routine.  I only gained 8 lbs throughout because I was 35 lbs overweight to begin with.  My daughter was born at 7lbs 3oz, and I left the hospital thinner than when I got pregnant.  The third child, I gained 20lbs and I had to start insulin much sooner.  Both children were healthy.  Just follow the doctors orders.  They will monitor your pregnancy much more, and you will be monitoring yourself 4-5 times a day.  If this is gestational only, everything returns to normal as soon as baby is born.  The baby might have low blood sugar for about 24 hours after being born.  That is because they produce more insulin to help you.  They almost always return to normal with that period also.  Good Luck, and God Bless.
